message.content:
cs.SI, cs.SD, cs.SOC, cs.DL, cs.IR 

This paper discusses a novel sociometric approach to analyzing coauthorship networks, which can complement traditional measures based on undirected networks and expand insights into coauthoring patterns such as the hierarchy of collaboration among scholars. This interdisciplinary work can fit into several arXiv CS sub-categories, including Social and Information Networks (cs.SI), Sound and Music Computing (cs.SD), Social and Economic Networks (cs.SOC), Digital Libraries (cs.DL), and Information Retrieval (cs.IR).
